Dan,
Just to tell you, I've run with much larger mechanisms, often over 500=

(sometimes even over 1000) species and over a thousand reactions with
a ze=
ro D constant pressure calculation with no problems...

I am not sure what =
you mean by 'crash', but one typical type of
problem I would have seemed to=
 be related to (I think) convergence
problems due to slightly misaligned (w=
arnings posted when translating
from CHEMKIN format) thermodynamics (regard=
less of size of mechanism)
-- It would not make it through the first iterat=
ion -- it can be quite
sensitive to this.

Hope this helps
Edward S. Bluroc=
k
Deparment of Energy Sciences
Lund University
Homepage: http://esblurock.i=
nfo
Email: edward.blurock@...

>
> Hi,
> 
> I was just curious if there is s=
ome sort of hard coded limit to the
> number of reactions or species that C=
antera can handle.  I'm trying to
> debug a program that uses Cantera, and =
the only difference between a
> run that works, and a run that crashes is t=
he mechanism that I'm using.
> 
> Works:  45 spec, 232 rxns
> Dies:  83 spe=
c, 530 rxns
> 
> Am I barking up the wrong tree on this one?
> 
> Thanks.
